trial_identification.studytitle: The measurement, ranking and identification of evidence-practice gaps in methods to reduce distress during procedures in the Childrens Emergency Department
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The measurement, ranking and identification of evidence-practice gaps in methods to reduce distress during procedures in the Childrens Emergency Department

interventions.interventions: Observation of distressing procedures in Childrens Emergency Department. Observed before procedure for a variable length of time (in fact length of time before procedure may be a contributing factor to distress), during the entire procedure and after the procedure while the child is in the procedure room.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Qualitative observations. These are currently non-focused observations looking at behaviours and language that either increase or decrease distress.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Observations will be focussed over several cycles. Observed before procedure for a variable length of time, during the entire procedure and after the procedure while the child is in the procedure room.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Visual analog scale and FLACC procedure pain scale (Face; Legs; Activity; Cry; Consolability).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Taken immediately before the procedure, during the procedure and at 2 minutes after cessation of procedure.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All children attending our department, all procedures. Procedures will be selected to include the most frequent procedures in the department that may cause distress.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Children in resuscitation will not be included due to consent timing issues.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The general aim of the project is to observe procedural distress occurring in the Childrens Emergency Department and identify areas for future interventions.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: New Zealand Northern X Regional Ethics Committee-Starship Children's Emergency Department

contact.name: Dr David Herd
contact.address: Childrens Emergency Department Starship Childrens Hospital Private Bag 92024 Auckland
